Gene: APO-E3/E4
rsID: rs429358(C;T) & rs7412(C;C)
Genotype: APOE3/E4
Key Facts: 2-3x increased risk for coronary artery disease and Alzheimerâ€™s; Elevated LDL levels may be observed; Lifestyle changes (low saturated fat, regular exercise) recommended.

Gene: ACE
rsID: rs4343
Genotype: (G;G)
Key Facts: Associated with higher ACE enzyme levels; Increased risk of hypertension and cardiovascular complications; Reducing total and saturated fat intake may help mitigate risk.

Supplement: Niacin
Dose: 500 mg
Effects:
 - Cardiovascular: Can raise HDL (good cholesterol) and lower triglycerides, potentially beneficial in certain heart-risk profiles. [Confidence: High]
 - Side Effects: Flushing is common with higher niacin doses; extended-release forms or aspirin pre-dosing can help reduce flushing. [Confidence: Medium]
 - Glucose Metabolism: At higher doses, niacin may worsen glycemic control in some individuals. [Confidence: Medium]
